roleset.name: throw outward, throw (dice, fishing lines, shadows)
roleset.note: CAST-V NOTES: Frames file for 'cast' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Comparison to 'cover'. (from cast.01-v)
CAST-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry cast.01, OntoNotes grouping senses 6, 7, 8; maps to VN class throw-17.1. Framed by Claire. (from cast.01-n)

example.name: cast a pall
example.text: All this has cast a pall over Columbia Savings& Loan Association and its high-rolling 43-year-old chairman, Thomas Spiegel, who built the $12.7 billion Beverly Hills, Calif., thrift with high-yield junk bonds.
example.arg: over Columbia Savings& Loan Association and its high-rolling 43-year-old chairman, Thomas Spiegel, who built the $12.7 billion Beverly Hills, Calif., thrift with high-yield junk bonds

example.name: cast doubt
example.text: That collapse, following on the heels of disarray in the market for high-risk, high-yield bonds, cast doubt on the entire takeover business, which has fueled both big profits among Wall Street securities firms and big gains in the stock market generally.
example.arg: That collapse, following on the heels of disarray in the market for high-risk, high-yield bonds,

example.name: cast a vote (metaphorical)
example.text: I 'm a happy camper as along as I-2 'm allowed [*-2] to cast my vote for who I think is the better candidate and make my annual political contribution of $ 0.00 to all campaigns .
example.arg: for who I think is the better candidate

example.name: cast nets. literal physical usage
example.text: Fishermen cast their nets into the Mekong River under a glowing sunset.

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: He lost a fortune on one cast of the dice.

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: The fisherman made a skillful cast of his line into the river.

example.name: Arg0 & TMP
example.text: But on his last cast of the day he latched into a fish he simply could not move.

example.name: casting call
example.text: *trace-1* Cast *trace-2* as Violetta Valery in a new production of Verdi's ``La Traviata,'' Ms. Gruberova last week did many things nicely and others not so well.
example.arg: in a new production of Verdi's ``La Traviata

roleset.name: make 3d reproductions from a mold
roleset.note: CAST-V NOTES: Updated by Julia. (from cast.03-v)

example.name: with source metal
example.text: But in fact, as early as the reign of the Western Han's Xuan Di, theminister in charge of agriculture, Geng Shouchang, is recorded * as *having "an astronomical device-1 cast *-1 of bronze, with which * to map theheavens *T*."
example.arg: with which to map the heavens

example.name: instructional
example.text: The sculptor will cast his sculpture by pouring the cement into a mould made from an original piece in a softer material
example.arg: by pouring the cement into a mould made from an original piece in a softer material

example.name: Sand is a material used to make the mould, not the sculpture
example.text: Possibly this work was a test piece, the artist challenging the founders to cast his sculpture in sand with the minimal cold work usually associated with lost-wax casting.
example.arg: with the minimal cold work usually associated with lost-wax casting

example.name: example with arg2 and argm-GOL
example.text: During the casting, a fired clay/sand casting funnel is bound on top of the mould to be able *PRO* to cast the bronze into the mould.

example.name: Medical cast
example.text: The ER's casting of the boy's broken arm was to stay in place for six weeks.

roleset.name: bandage in plaster
roleset.note: CAST-V NOTES: Based on temprel data. No comparison. No VN class. Framed by Katie. (from cast.04-v)

example.name: arg 1 as the patient himself
example.text: [He-1] broke his ankle in the eight grade and was casted [*-1]

example.name: arg 1 as the body part
example.text: Dr. Payne cast John's leg in glow-in-the-dark fiberglass after Mary tripped him.
